title: Unprecedented Dexus deal could kickstart mall trend
text:
One of Australia's biggest commercial landlords has bought a retail centre in Sydney's western suburbs with plans to convert it into an industrial property over the next five years – a move that could kickstart a trend already seen in the United States.

Dexus acquired Homemaker Prospect, a 25,770sq m large-format retail centre near Blacktown, for about $65 million on a 7 per cent yield from Altis after the private equity real estate firm first listed it for sale in early 2018. Altis bought the asset in 2013 for $40.45 million.

Homemaker Prospect

"It’s a fantastic location, it’s been bought with a great holding income, and our intention is to convert it over time to industrial," Darren Steinberg, chief executive of Dexus, told The Australian Financial Review.

"We believe it will be as successful as our nearby Quarry industrial estate development at Greystanes."

It's the first such instance of a shopping centre or large retail precinct being acquired for an industrial conversion, but it's not surprising given strong demand for the asset class combined with a lack of available land in the middle rings of our capital cities.
description: One of Australia's biggest commercial landlords has bought a retail centre in Sydney's western suburbs with plans to convert it into an industrial property, a move that could kickstart a trend seen in the US.
